definition: to handle/to manage/to put in order/to arrange/to administer/to execute/to take action on/to plan
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered

sentences.english: The speed of change is rapid, the statistics bewildering.
sentences.chinese: 變化速度之快，令統計工作手足無措。

sentences.english: You are still fumbling in tatal hopelessness?
sentences.chinese: 你還在失望中茫然無措嗎？

sentences.english: The ship bilge and they didn't know what to do.
sentences.chinese: 船底漏水了，他們束手無措。

sentences.english: Don't you see that he has losen his head?
sentences.chinese: 難道，你沒看到他手足無措的樣子？

sentences.english: In my fumbled excitement, I misdialed my brother's phone number three times.
sentences.chinese: 由於激動得手足無措，我三次錯撥了弟弟的電話號碼。

sentences.english: If American dominance is challenged, it will be at sea.
sentences.chinese: 如果美國的主導地位被改變，它將茫然無措。

sentences.english: The announcement left investors feeling wronged and wrong-footed.
sentences.chinese: 該聲明讓投資者覺得憋屈和手足無措。

sentences.english: When RongTian etc, to manage to brother won idea to tell the truth.
sentences.chinese: 當榮田等人手足無措時，至嬴主意向兄長說出真相。

sentences.english: As recent as yesterday, I was ignorantly pleased with myself.
sentences.chinese: 最近，也就是昨天，我爲自己的無措而懊惱。

sentences.english: Ifyou start fidgeting with your leg you’ll soon start to feel nervous oranxious.
sentences.chinese: 如果你開始手足無措，你就開始緊張了。

sentences.english: Most days, I felt utterly dazed.
sentences.chinese: 在大多數時候，我感到完全茫然無措。

sentences.english: You then in the midst of life and I for some blind.
sentences.chinese: 在你之後生活中我是那麼的茫然無措。

sentences.english: Then I am running at a loss.
Rampant free enterprise also lives uncomfortably alongside the country’s official ideology.
sentences.chinese: 猖獗的自由企業在國家的官方意識形態下也手足無措。

sentences.english: You got me chasin' rabbits, walkin' on my hands and howlin' at the moon.
sentences.chinese: 是你讓我心煩意亂，手足無措，對着月亮長吁短嘆。

sentences.english: When confronted with financial storm, are you at a loss?
sentences.chinese: 面對席捲而來的金融風暴，您是否手足無措？

definition: at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
not knowing which course to follow (idiom); at a loss what to do
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
to be at a loss for words/speechless
